s1.message: The following lists the major changes compared to Adblock Plus 1.0.2:

s3.message: Thunderbird: When clicking "Subscribe" in the subscription list on first run, the entire Thunderbird window is closed. This should be fixed in Thunderbird soon (bug 503299).

s4.message: SeaMonkey: Toolbar icon looks ugly with the Modern theme. Modern theme doesn't seem to consider the possibility of extensions, using it with Adblock Plus isn't recommended.

s5.message: Some translations contain untranslated English strings.

s7.message: Added handling of HTTP redirects, the redirect address now shows up in the list of blockable items as well as the original address, both can be blocked.

s8.message: Added support for flexible anchors at start of filter (forum topic).

s9.message: Added support for ^ character that will match a single separator character or end of address (forum topic).

s10.message: Added support for domain exceptions in element hiding analogous to the $domain option of regular filters, e.g. "example.com,~foo.example.com##foo" or "~example.com##foo" (forum topic).

s12.message: "Block" button on plug-ins (e.g. Flash or Java) is no longer shown permanently, it only shows up when the mouse is on the plug-in area.

s13.message: Added "Re-enable Adblock Plus on this page" context menu item for pages where Adblock Plus is disabled, this removes/disables the filter responsible.

s14.message: Browser integration code runs in its own context now, this makes conflicts with other extensions less likely.

s15.message: Changed the way "add subscription" links work, these can now only be triggered by user clicking a link.

s16.message: Added diagnostic page displaying all errors related to Adblock Plus as well as Adblock Plus version/source code revision, can be opened by typing

s19.message: Fixed: ABP icon updates its status every two seconds, hogs CPU time.

s20.message: Fixed: Detection of background images breaks the context menu.

s21.message: Fixed: "Disable on ..." doesn't work correctly if the exception rule already exists but is disabled.

s22.message: Fixed: "Disable on ..." doesn't work correctly with rules that already exist in filter subscriptions rather than user-defined filters.

s23.message: Fixed: Input focus issues when closing list of blockable items in current Firefox nightly builds.

s25.message: Added "document source" column, hidden by default (domain name to be used for the $domain filter option, forum topic).

s26.message: Added "Disable this filter on example.com" context menu item for user-defined filters (adds $domain option as required).

s27.message: Fixed: Creating a filter for an item matching a disabled exception rule wasn't possible again (forum topic).

s29.message: "Slow filter" warning is now a separate list column which can be used for sorting.

s30.message: Using browser's real find bar now instead of faking it.

s31.message: "Close" button moved to the right side of the filter editor, made the button use Firefox 3 look.

s32.message: Improved position calculations for the filter editor, no longer makes the text position change.

s33.message: Fixed: Enabling/disabling many element hiding rules at once is slow.

s34.message: When a list of filters is pasted or imported, always insert comments before the filter that follows them (forum topic, forum topic).

s35.message: Fixed: Adding a filter subscription that redirects to a different address causes download failure.

s36.message: Fixed: Same filter might appear twice in the list in a particular scenario.

s37.message: Fixed: Wrong row is selected when the window is opened (worked around bug 489881).

s39.message: Added flexible anchors as an option — "at the beginning of domain name" (forum topic).

s40.message: Added "example.com^" as fourth suggestion, block the entire domain (forum topic).

s41.message: Added warning when adding a filter to a disabled filter group (forum topic).

s43.message: Dropped compatibility with old application versions and cleaned up code, now requiring at least: Firefox 3.0.9, SeaMonkey 2.0b1, Thunderbird 3.0b3, Songbird 1.2, Prism 1.0b1.

s44.message: Moved almost all application-specific code to the overlay file corresponding with that application, this should make application-specific changes easier in future.

s45.message: Fixed: Toolbar icon cannot be moved to a different location (SeaMonkey).

s46.message: Fixed: Toolbar icon might be added in one window but not another on first start (SeaMonkey and Thunderbird).

s47.message: Fixed: Indentation of some menu items of the toolbar icon's menu too large (Songbird).

s50.message: Added explicit support for blocking fonts (@font-type CSS directive in Firefox 3.5).

s51.message: Clearing browsing history in Firefox now clears hit statistics in Adblock Plus as well (this can be disabled with the hidden extensions.adblockplus.clearStatsOnHistoryPurge preference, forum topic).

s52.message: Cleaned up data management code, made sure Adblock Plus doesn't use up more memory than necessary.

s53.message: Fixed: Webpages can easily detect "Collapse blocked elements" option.

s54.message: Fixed: An error is reported to console on first run (patterns.ini not found).

s55.message: Fixed: Domain-restricted filters were applied to pages opened from disk.
